title: E field - zero field location between Q and 2Q

content.question: Two positive point charges, one with charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and one with charge <math alttext="positive 2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, are fixed in place a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from each other. Which of the following statements is correct about the electric field due to the two point charges?

choices.label: The electric field is zero at the midpoint between the two point charges.
The electric field is zero at a location between the point charges and closer to the one of charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>.
The electric field is zero at a location between the point charges and closer to the one of charge <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math>.
The electric field will not be zero at any location between the two point charges.

content.answer: The electric field is zero at a location between the point charges and closer to the one of charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>.
